title: Project A - JavaScript Testing Framework
description: A modern, lightweight JavaScript testing framework designed for speed and simplicity. Perfect for unit testing, integration testing, and end-to-end testing workflows.

sections.heading: Overview
sections.body: Project A provides a comprehensive testing solution for JavaScript applications. Built from the ground up with performance in mind, it offers lightning-fast test execution without sacrificing functionality. Whether you're testing React components, Node.js APIs, or vanilla JavaScript functions, Project A has you covered.

sections.heading: Key Features
sections.body:
• Zero configuration setup - works out of the box
• Parallel test execution for maximum speed
• Built-in mocking and stubbing capabilities
• Code coverage reports with detailed insights
• Watch mode for continuous development
• TypeScript support with full type safety
• Snapshot testing for UI components
• Custom reporters and extensible architecture

sections.heading: Quick Start
sections.body:
Getting started with Project A is simple:

1. Install via npm: `npm install --save-dev project-a`
2. Add test script to package.json: `"test": "project-a"`
3. Create your first test file: `example.test.js`
4. Run tests: `npm test`

No configuration files needed - Project A uses sensible defaults that work for most projects.

sections.heading: Browser Support
sections.body:
Project A supports all modern browsers and Node.js environments:
• Chrome 90+
• Firefox 88+
• Safari 14+
• Edge 90+
• Node.js 16+

For older browser support, Project A includes polyfills and transpilation options.
